attack-object.name: Brute Force
attack-object.comments: At first glance, this control seems mappable to Exfiltration (sub-)techniques but upon further analysis, it doesn't really mitigate exfiltration but rather its prerequisite Collection (sub-)techniques.
attack-object.score-comment: Conditional Access can be used to enforce MFA for users which provides significant protection against  password compromises, requiring an adversary to complete an additional authentication method before their access is permitted.

attack-object.name: Valid Accounts
attack-object.comments: At first glance, this control seems mappable to Exfiltration (sub-)techniques but upon further analysis, it doesn't really mitigate exfiltration but rather its prerequisite Collection (sub-)techniques.
attack-object.score-comment: This control only provides minimal protection for this technique's procedure examples along and also only protects one of its sub-techniques resulting in an overall Minimal score.

attack-object.name: Data Staged
attack-object.comments: At first glance, this control seems mappable to Exfiltration (sub-)techniques but upon further analysis, it doesn't really mitigate exfiltration but rather its prerequisite Collection (sub-)techniques.
attack-object.score-comment: This control only provides the ability to restrict file downloads for a limited set of applications and therefore its overall Coverage score is minimal.

attack-object.name: Data from Cloud Storage Object
attack-object.comments: At first glance, this control seems mappable to Exfiltration (sub-)techniques but upon further analysis, it doesn't really mitigate exfiltration but rather its prerequisite Collection (sub-)techniques.
attack-object.score-comment: Conditional Access, when granting (risky) users access to cloud storage, specifically OneDrive, can restrict what they can do in these applications using its app-enforced restrictions.   For example, it can enforce that users on unmanaged devices will have browser-only access to OneDrive with no ability to download, print, or sync files.  This can impede an adversary's ability to exfiltrate data from OneDrive.  The protection coverage provided by this control is Minimal as it doesn't provide protection for other storage services available on Azure such as the Azure Storage service.

attack-object.name: Data from Information Repositories
attack-object.comments: At first glance, this control seems mappable to Exfiltration (sub-)techniques but upon further analysis, it doesn't really mitigate exfiltration but rather its prerequisite Collection (sub-)techniques.
attack-object.score-comment: This control only provides the ability to restrict an adversary from collecting valuable information for a limited set of applications (SharePoint, Exchange, OneDrive) and therefore its overall Coverage score is minimal.
